steps_with_score.step: There is a horizontal bar chart with five categories on the y-axis: grant, birth, boy, field, and cash.
The x-axis is labeled "Values", with tick marks ranging from 0.0 to 10.0 at intervals of 2.5.
Each bar corresponds to the value for its respective category. The length of each bar represents the value on the x-axis.
Visually, the "field" bar is the longest among all displayed bars.
The end of the "field" bar aligns closely with the 6.0 mark on the x-axis.
We need to determine the value of the largest bar; this means identifying which bar extends furthest on the x-axis.
Examining the horizontal bars, "field" is clearly the longest.
The "field" bar ends a little past the 5.0 tick and before the 7.5 tick; visually, it is closest to 6.0.
By comparing its endpoint to the tick marks, we deduce the length of the bar is 6.
Therefore, the value of the largest bar is 6.
